title: Album Page, "Lantern at Amboise", late 19th century
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick white wove paper mounted to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: (inscribed in circle) 103; at bottom right of drawing: Lantern at Amboise; at bottom right edge of sheet: 1943-51-168.
dimensions: 16.1 x 12.6 cm (6 5/16 x 4 15/16 in.), irregular; mount: 31.9 x 24.9 cm (12 9/16 x 9 13/16 in.), irregular
description: Sheet has been cut down to vertical rectangle orientation.  Depicted is a lantern mounted to an ashlar masonry wall.  The lantern is seen from the corner and two sides are visible.  Each side has a rectangular opening that seems as though it is filled with small green glass roundels.  Above is a small row of open quatrefoils.  There is a small finial below and a small crenellated steeple-like cone for ventilation above.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Lantern at Amboise", late 19th century.
late 19th century. Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick white wove paper mounted to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-168.
